intro: Platanthera viridis var. bracteata, commonly known as the green twayblade, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in association with other orchids. It has a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, which help it absorb nutrients from the soil. The species is considered rare and is often protected in its native habitats.
